trans-unit.source:
This includes return statements, break and continue statements, and other jumps.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The target label where this node jumps to.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The value passed to the target, or null if the target is of type System.Void.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxx Xxxxxx.Xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx$ xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
